DataElement.preferredName: Esophageal Carcinoma Trachea Bronchus Invasion Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether local spread of a malignant epithelial tumor arising from the esophageal mucosa by infiltration into or destruction of adjacent tissue of the cartilaginous and membranous tube descending from the larynx or the right or left main bronchi was found.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the local spread of a malignant epithelial tumor arising from the esophageal mucosa by infiltration into or destruction of adjacent tissue of the cartilaginous and membranous tube descending from the larynx or the right or left main bronchi.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant epithelial tumor arising from the esophageal mucosa.  Two major histologic types of esophageal carcinoma have been described: squamous cell carcinoma and adenocarcinoma.  This type of cancer is associated with excessive ethanol and cigarette usage.  --2002

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial tumor arising from the esophageal mucosa. Two major histologic types of esophageal carcinoma have been described: squamous cell carcinoma and adenocarcinoma. This type of cancer is associated with excessive ethanol and cigarette usage.

Property.preferredDefinition: The cartilaginous and membranous tube descending from the larynx and branching into the right and left main bronchi.:(BRONK-eye) The large air passages that lead from the trachea (windpipe) to the lungs.:Local spread of a malignant neoplasm by infiltration or destruction of adjacent tissue; for epithelial neoplasms, invasion signifies infiltration beneath the epithelial basement membrane.

Concepts.definition: The fibrocartilaginous, mucous-lined tube passing from the larynx to the bronchi.
Tubular structure in continuation with the trachea, serving as air passage. It terminates in the lung (terminal bronchiole).

The local spread of tumor cells of a malignant neoplasm through infiltration or destruction of adjacent tissue; for epithelial neoplasms, invasion signifies infiltration beneath the epithelial basement membrane.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
